channel.title: Introduction :: K-State CIS 642/643 Textbook
channel.description: The waterfall model of software development breaks the process of creating software into discrete phases, as seen in this diagram: The phases correspond to specific steps that must be carried out to create the software: Requirements involves determining exactly what the software needs to do, as well as what platform(s) it needs to run on. Design involves designing the software system to meet those requirements - i.e. laying out a high-level architecture, often specifying this architecture with UML or similar approaches.
